title: Rift deepens? Cong cites Tharoor’s own book 'Paradoxical Prime Minister' in fresh jibe
content: Shashi Tharoor faces internal criticism within the Congress party after remarks in Panama seemingly credited the Modi government with initiating cross-border strikes, contradicting his own previous writings. Fellow Congress members, including Pawan Khera and Udit Raj, have publicly rebuked Tharoor, citing his book and historical military actions to challenge his statements.

title: Changed locations, suicide notes: How Mittal family’s final hours unfolded in Panchkula
content: Investigations into the Panchkula mass suicide case reveal the Mittal family initially planned to end their lives at Dr B R Ambedkar Bhawan before choosing Sector 27. CCTV footage confirmed their presence at the bhawan, but they later moved to Sector 27, where the tragic event occurred.

title: Lack of water at Karachi airport? Pak actor slams authorities in viral video
content: Pakistani actor Hina Bayat used social media to highlight a critical water shortage at Karachi's Jinnah International Airport on Youm-e-Takbir. She expressed disappointment that on a day of national celebration, basic amenities like water in airport restrooms were lacking. Bayat questioned the deterioration of essential systems and the neglect of existing infrastructure in favor of new projects.

title: 'Citizens warned against illegal travel agencies': Iran after 3 Indians go missing
content: Following the disappearance of three Indian citizens after traveling to Iran, the Iranian Embassy in India has cautioned Indian citizens against unauthorized travel agencies. The Indian Embassy in Tehran has urged Iranian authorities for an immediate investigation, while Iranian officials assured they are coordinating with judicial authorities and keeping the Indian Embassy informed.

title: Elon Musk’s 72-hr ‘ultimatum’ to Apple that may have split Tim Cook’s team
content: In 2022, Elon Musk issued a 72-hour ultimatum to Apple, demanding a $5 billion deal for SpaceX to become the exclusive satellite provider for iPhones. Apple rejected the offer, leading to a three-year conflict involving regulatory challenges and internal dissent within Apple regarding its satellite strategy. Despite the challenges and internal resistance, Apple has invested heavily in Globalstar, signaling its commitment to satellite connectivity.

title: Karnataka power struggle: Sparks fly again between CM Siddaramaiah & DK Shivakumar
content: A power struggle between Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar has resurfaced over the transfer of five senior engineers. Shivakumar, overseeing Water Resources, demanded the Chief Secretary withdraw the orders, citing a violation of protocol as the transfers occurred without his approval.

title: Replacing this food from one meal can be beneficial for liver health: Experts
content: A recent study reveals that swapping meat for plant-based protein in just one meal can significantly benefit individuals with liver disease. Researchers found that this dietary change lowers harmful ammonia levels, which are linked to cirrhosis and cognitive decline. Experts emphasize that even small dietary adjustments can positively impact liver health.

title: How 1 saline bottle ended up killing 8 in Tamil Nadu
content: A recent Lancet study revealed that eight people in Tamil Nadu's Tirupattur district died in 2023 from neuromelioidosis contracted at a dental clinic. The outbreak, linked to unsterile practices, involved a contaminated saline bottle used during dental procedures. Researchers found the bacteria, Burkholderia pseudomallei, entered through nerve pathways, leading to rapid and severe brain infections.

title: Anupam Mittal says, I bet the real issue Trump is going after Harvard is ...
content: Shark Tank India's Anupam Mittal recently ignited social media with a pointed remark directed at Donald Trump, suggesting the former US President's criticism of Harvard stems from his inability to gain admission. This jab comes amid Trump's ongoing feud with elite universities, which he accuses of liberal bias.

title: 'Ideologically driven': China slams US decision to revoke student visas
content: China has condemned the United States' recent decision to revoke visas of Chinese students, deeming it unreasonable and ideologically driven. This action follows Secretary of State Marco Rubio's announcement of stricter visa policies targeting students with alleged ties to the Chinese Communist Party or those in sensitive fields.

title: Should Shashi Tharoor be suspended from Congress? What Udit Raj said
content: Congress leader Udit Raj criticized Shashi Tharoor for allegedly undermining the party's legacy. Raj accused Tharoor of defending security lapses in the Pahalgam incident and glorifying PM Modi's surgical strikes during Tharoor's address in Panama.

title: ‘Overstepped authority': US court's scathing observations against Trump
content: A US trade court has blocked most of Donald Trump's tariff measures, deeming that he overstepped his authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. The court's decision, which consolidates multiple lawsuits, invalidates tariffs imposed on countries like Canada, Mexico, and China. The White House has criticized the ruling and immediately filed an appeal, but other Trump-era tariffs remain valid.

title: ‘Musk to work 40 hours a week’: Tesla top investors demand amid sales drop
content: Major Tesla investors are urging Elon Musk to dedicate at least 40 hours a week to the electric car company due to concerns over declining sales and a weakened reputation. They believe Musk's involvement in other ventures and political activities has diverted his attention from Tesla, impacting its performance.

title: 'PM wants tareef, not talks on tariff': Congress targets PM Modi
content: Jairam Ramesh criticizes Narendra Modi for ignoring Donald Trump's ceasefire claims. Trump said tariffs pushed India and Pakistan towards peace. Ramesh questions Modi's silence and Trump equating India and Pakistan. He also slams the government for not addressing security concerns after the Pahalgam attack. Congress wants a Parliament session on PoK and terrorism. They accuse BJP of inaction against terrorists.

title: 'MS Dhoni barged on to the field... Virat Kohli not banned'
content: Virender Sehwag has criticised the BCCI for inconsistently applying disciplinary actions in the IPL. He cited Digvesh Rathi's suspension for Code of Conduct breaches, contrasting it with lighter penalties for past incidents involving MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli. Rathi's suspension stemmed from accumulated demerit points, while Dhoni and Kohli, despite controversies, never reached the suspension threshold.

title: Rotten duck eggs & electric shocks: Torture tales from Myanmar hell-hole
content: Indian jobseekers trafficked to Myanmar by fraudulent IT firms faced brutal punishments, including being forced to eat frozen, rotten duck eggs and subjected to electric shocks for resisting internet scams or failing to meet fraud targets. One victim recounted the horrific conditions and torture endured, highlighting the urgent need for vigilance against deceptive overseas job offers.

title: UPSSSC final answer key 2025 for junior analyst, assistant accountant released
content: The UPSSSC has released the final answer keys for the Junior Analyst (Food) and Assistant Accountant & Auditor Main Exams 2025, following the review of objections. Candidates can now download the answer keys from the official website to estimate their scores. The results are expected in June 2025, after which document verification and further selection procedures will commence.

title: Bootlegger escapes, horse stays in station: Bihar cops stuck with unusual custody
content: In West Champaran, a horse became the responsibility of Nautan police. The horse was caught carrying smuggled liquor. The smuggler, Akash Yadav, is still absconding. Police are now caring for the animal. They are seeking an animal lover to take custody. The custodian must produce the horse in court if needed. After the trial, the state will auction the horse.

title: Indian Railways to achieve net zero goal 5 years ahead of target
content: Indian Railways is set to achieve net-zero targets by year-end, surpassing its 2030 goal through extensive electrification. Aiming for 95% electric traction by 2030, it anticipates significant carbon emission reductions. The shift includes sourcing renewable and nuclear energy, targeting 10 GW of electricity by the decade's end.

title: IPL Qualifier 1: Iyer's PBKS brace for trial by fire against Kohli's RCB
content: Punjab Kings (PBKS) are slightly ahead when it comes to head-to-head against the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). PBKS have won 18 matches, while RCB have come out on top in 17 games out of the 35 fixtures the league's perennial underachievers have played against each other. They have finished second on the IPL points table, and the winner will qualify directly for the final, while the loser will get another crack in Qualifier 2.

title: Asylum in UK? I don’t want, I will live in India: Booker Prize winner Banu Mushtaq
content: Banu Mushtaq, the International Booker Prize winner, affirmed her commitment to India. She dismissed suggestions of seeking asylum in London. During a book promotion event, she was offered asylum due to perceived unrest in India. Banu clarified her intention to remain in India. She also shared her experiences with the Booker Prize.

title: Doctor jailed in Pune Porsche crash case now arrested in kidney transplant scam
content: Dr. Ajay Taware, already jailed for tampering with blood samples in the Pune Porsche crash case, has been arrested again. Pune Police took him into custody on Thursday for his alleged involvement in a 2022 kidney transplant racket at Ruby Hall Clinic. As head of the Regional Authorisation Committee, he oversaw kidney transplant approvals.

title: Delhi HC allows DPS Dwarka students back in class, orders 50% payment of hiked fees
content: The Delhi High Court has granted interim relief to DPS Dwarka students expelled over unpaid hiked fees, allowing them to resume classes if 50% of the increased fee is paid. The case stems from a broader dispute over fee hikes, alleged coercion by the school, and demands for a transparent audit of the institution's finances.

title: Bank holidays 2025: Are banks closed on May 29 for Maharana Pratap Jayanti?
content: Himachal Pradesh banks observed a holiday on May 29 for Maharana Pratap Jayanti. Banking services were unavailable in Shimla and other areas. Digital banking remained operational nationwide. The Reserve Bank of India released holiday schedules. Earlier in May, banks were closed for other regional holidays.

title: Watch: Bangladesh, South Africa young cricketers come to blows
content: During a four-day match between Bangladesh and South Africa Emerging Teams, a physical altercation erupted between Tshepo Ntuli and Ripon Mondol after Mondol hit a six. The exchange escalated, involving shoves and helmet pulling, requiring umpire intervention. Tensions remained high, and the incident follows earlier suspensions in the one-day leg of the tour, prompting further investigation by cricket authorities.

title: 'People of PoK are our own, part of our family': Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, at the CII summit, asserted India's firm stance: dialogue with Pakistan will solely address terrorism and PoK. He emphasized PoK residents as integral to India, envisioning reunification. Singh highlighted India's evolved counter-terrorism strategy, stating Pakistan is paying a heavy price for sponsoring terror.

title: Diabetes signs and symptoms that occur at night
content: Low blood sugar at night, also called nocturnal hypoglycemia, happens when blood glucose falls below 70 mg/dL during sleep.(though this range can vary) It is common in people taking insulin, or certain diabetes medications that cause blood sugar to drop.

title: Trump’s 'big beautiful bill', budget cuts miss the mark: 5 reasons why Musk may have walked away
content: Elon Musk concluded his advisory role to President Trump, casting shadows on the future of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Musk cited the end of his term as a Special Government Employee and disagreements over Trump's "big beautiful bill" as key factors. Frustration with bureaucratic hurdles and limited success in achieving substantial spending cuts also contributed to his decision.

title: BJP MP cites declassified letter to Rajiv Gandhi questioning nuclear pact
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey alleged that the 1988 India-Pakistan nuclear agreement occurred under US pressure during Rajiv Gandhi's tenure. Sharing a purported declassified letter from Ronald Reagan, Dubey claimed the US dictated the agenda. He questioned Congress's silence and accused past governments of aligning with US interests, citing examples like Afghanistan and the Shimla Agreement.

title: Public sector banks drive India’s banking profits to highest ever in history
content: India's public sector banks have spearheaded a remarkable turnaround, driving the banking sector to record profits of Rs 3.71 lakh crore. Fueled by increased lending income and reduced NPAs, PSU banks saw a 26% profit surge, nearing private banks' earnings.

title: Tharoor-led delegation shows Pak army photos at terrorists' funeral to Panama president
content: A delegation led by Shashi Tharoor met with Panamanian officials, presenting evidence of Pakistan Army's involvement in supporting terrorism by attending funerals of UN-designated terrorists. Panama expressed strong support for India's stance against terrorism and showed interest in collaborating with India in technology, education, and pharmaceuticals. Discussions also included potential visits between leaders of both countries.

title: Rajasthan govt employee, assistant to Congress neta, held for spying for ISI
content: A state government employee in Rajasthan, Sakur Khan Mangaliyar, has been detained on suspicion of spying for Pakistan's ISI. The arrest follows a wider crackdown on espionage networks after Op Sindoor. Authorities are investigating possible links between Mangaliyar and a Congress politician, as well as his frequent trips to Pakistan and suspicious phone activity.

title: Cab fight at Mumbai airport: Driver drags rival on bonnet for kilometres
content: A petty argument between two cab drivers escalated into a dangerous situation at Mumbai airport. Justin J jumped onto Bhimprasad Mahanto's cab bonnet, who then sped off onto the Western Express Highway. A video of Justin clinging to the speeding car went viral. Police detained Mahanto and seized his vehicle after Justin filed a complaint.

title: Veteran actor Rajesh passes away at 75; Tamil cinema mourns the loss of a legend
content: Veteran Tamil actor Rajesh passed away at 75 due to breathing difficulties, leaving the Tamil film industry in mourning. Known for his versatile roles in films like 'Aval Oru Thodarkathai' and 'Virumandi,' Rajesh shared the screen with stars like Kamal Haasan and Vijay. Beyond acting, he explored real estate and astrology, authoring books and running a YouTube channel.

title: 'For sake of peace': After Op Sindoor, Pak changes tune, calls for dialogue with India
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has again expressed his willingness to engage in dialogue with India to resolve critical issues such as Kashmir, water sharing, and terrorism. This call for peace follows a similar statement made earlier in the week, amidst heightened tensions following a recent terrorist attack and India's retaliatory military actions.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Should you buy or sell today?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: MCX Gold is resuming its upward trend, potentially reaching 98,000, supported by geopolitical tensions and inflationary concerns. MCX Silver exhibits strong bullish momentum, targeting 1,01,800, driven by robust demand and macroeconomic uncertainties.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 24,850; BSE Sensex rises over 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 24,850, BSE Sensex rose over 500 points.

title: 'Limit to political desperation': BJP wades into Cong crossfire as Udit Raj targets Tharoor
content: Amidst internal discord within the Congress party, Shashi Tharoor faces criticism from colleague Udit Raj over remarks lauding India's counterterror strikes during an international delegation visit. BJP leaders, including Kiren Rijiju and Shehzad Poonawalla, have rallied around Tharoor, questioning Congress's commitment to national interest.

title: Elon Musk to exit US govt role after criticising Trump's 'big beautiful bill': 10 things to know
content: Elon Musk concluded his tenure as a Special Government Employee, stepping down as a top adviser to President Trump amid disagreements over a controversial spending bill. Musk's departure follows his criticism of the "One Big, Beautiful Bill Act," citing concerns about its impact on the budget deficit.

title: Why China is going behind the asteroids with its Tianwen-2 Mission
content: China's Tianwen-2 mission, launched on May 28, 2025, aims to collect samples from the quasi-satellite asteroid 469219 Kamo‘oalewa, potentially a fragment of the Moon. Following this, the spacecraft will journey to comet 311P/PANSTARRS around 2035. This ambitious mission seeks to understand planetary origins, develop new technologies, and enhance China's space exploration capabilities.

title: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams complete recovery phase
content: Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams completed their Earth return and physical therapy after an extended stay on the ISS due to Starliner complications. They are now involved in Boeing and NASA initiatives, managing post-flight recovery while addressing pre-existing physical issues exacerbated by gravity's return. NASA considers another uncrewed Starliner flight before resuming human missions, pending summer testing results.

title: Hikers call 911 over 'dead' friend, turns out they were high on mushrooms
content: A harrowing 911 call from the Adirondacks led forest rangers to a bizarre scene. Two hikers, under the influence of psychedelic mushrooms, reported their friend dead and themselves lost near Cascade Mountain. Rangers discovered the pair in an altered state, while their supposedly deceased companion was found alive and unharmed, leading to a confused reunion and medical attention for the tripping duo.

title: Early signs of magnesium deficiency that are sometimes ignored
content: One of the most common early signs is muscle cramps or twitches. Magnesium helps muscles relax after they contract. Without enough magnesium, muscles can become tight and cramp easily. You might notice cramps in your legs, especially at night, or small twitches under your skin, causing involuntary movements.

title: IPL 2025 league recap: Teenage ton, pricey flop - the highs and the lows
content: IPL 2025 witnessed Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive entry alongside Rishabh Pant's struggles, amidst a season disrupted by border conflicts. Mumbai Indians staged a comeback, Gujarat Titans maintained composure, and Royal Challengers Bengaluru dominated away games. Punjab Kings exceeded expectations, while Chennai Super Kings faltered, setting the stage for a thrilling playoff showdown.

title: Golden retriever hired as ‘chief happiness officer’ at Hyd startup, wins hearts
content: Hyderabad-based startup Harvesting Robotics has appointed a golden retriever named Denver as its Chief Happiness Officer, sparking online buzz. Co-founder Rahul Arepaka's LinkedIn post introducing Denver went viral, highlighting the pup's role in boosting office morale. The company has embraced a pet-friendly environment, with Denver's presence bringing unexpected positivity.

title: US will 'aggressively revoke' visas for Chinese students: Rubio
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced the US will revoke visas for some Chinese students with ties to the Chinese Communist Party or studying critical fields. This action, coupled with stricter visa guidelines and social media surveillance, intensifies uncertainty for international students. Concerns rise over potential talent deterrence and the erosion of the US as a global education hub, as students express fear of being treated as threats.

title: "Contracts Signed, Systems Never Come": Air Chief's Bombshell
content: India's Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh has raised concerns over delays in major defence procurement projects.

title: Rajasthan Man who 'Spied' For Pak Had Links With Ex-Minister: Sources
content: According to sources, the 'spy' Shakur Khan was working as a personal assistant to former minister Shale Mohammad under the Congress regime in Rajasthan.

title: "Case Being Followed Up": Iran On 3 Indians Missing In Tehran
content: Iran on Thursday said that the case of three Indian nationals, who have gone missing in Tehran, is being followed up by its foreign ministry in coordination with the relevant judicial authorities, and India is being kept informed about the developmen

title: Rahul Gandhi Claims Savarkar-Godse "Blood Relation" In Defamation Affidavit
content: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has claimed that Hindutva ideologue Vinayak Savarkar was a relative of Mahatma Gandhi's killer, Nathuram Godse

title: Deep Depression Over Bay Of Bengal To Trigger Heavy Rain In Odisha: Weather Office
content: The IMD stated that the depression over the northwest Bay of Bengal moved nearly northwards with a speed of 20 kmph during the past 3 hours.

title: Pics: Who Is Ingrid Alexandra, Norwegian Princess Who Moved To Australia
content: Princess Ingrid Alexandra of Norway, 21, is the daughter of Crown Prince Haakon and Crown Princess Mette-Marit.

title: Meet Charlotte Walker, Australia's Youngest Female Senator At 21
content: Charlotte Walker has made history by becoming the youngest female senator of Australia at the age of 21. Despite

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Pakistan's New 'Crypto' Obsession Could Turn Dangerous
content: By embracing digital currency without resolving its foundational vulnerabilities in both its energy infrastructure and financial governance, Pakistan may not be catalysing a revolution, but rather courting a crisis.

title: Kerala Man Hits Rs 8.5 Crore Jackpot For 2nd Time In Dubai Lottery
content: An Indian man living in the UAE won $1 million in the famous Dubai Duty-Free Millennium Millionaire competition, his second win in less than ten years.

title: Harvard To Hold Graduation Ceremony In Shadow Of Trump 'Retribution'
content: Harvard is due to hold its annual graduation ceremony as federal judge considers the punitive measures taken against the university by President Donald Trump that threaten to overshadow festivities, challenging its foreign student policy and funding.

title: Karnataka Sets Up Anti-Communal Task Force After 2 Murders In Mangaluru
content: The task force will be headed by a Deputy Inspector General (DIG)-level officer and will be activated in three districts - Mangaluru, Udupi, and Shivamogga.

title: Lokpal Order Says All Charges Against Madhabi Puri Buch 'Baseless': 5 Points
content: SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch received a clean chit from the anti-corruption ombudsman Lokpal, which termed charges against her in a Hindenburg Research report as "presumptions and assumptions" not supported by any verifiable material.

title: PM Modi To Lay Foundation For Phase-2 Of Varanasi-Kolkata Expressway Today
content: In a landmark move to boost infrastructure and connectivity in eastern India, PM Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone for the second phase of the Varanasi-Gaya-Ranchi-Kolkata Expressway (NH-319B) on Thursday, during his visit to Bihar.

title: Mullaiperiyar Dam's Water Level Rises, Flood Alert Issued In Tamil Nadu
content: Following continuous rainfall over the past few days, the water level in the Mullaiperiyar dam has surged significantly, prompting authorities to issue a flood warning for residents living downstream.

title: India Poised To Remain Fastest Growing Major Economy In FY26: RBI
content: The country is poised to remain the fastest growing major economy in the world even in FY26, the Reserve Bank said on Thursday.

title: Japan Prohibits "Sparkly" Baby Names Like Nike, Pikachu. Here's Why
content: Japanese parents can no longer name their children Naiki (Nike), Pikachu, Kitty, Pudding, Daiya (diamond), or Pu (from Winnie-the-Pooh).

title: The Sinwar Plot: How Hamas Outwitted Israel, Until It Didn't
content: Yahya Sinwar was born in 1962 in the Khan Younis refugee camp in Gaza, the eldest of several brothers in a family displaced during the 1948 Arab-Israeli war. His younger brother, Mohammed, was born in 1975 in the same camp.

title: "Russia Hoax": Trump Says NYT, Washington Post Will Have To Return Pulitzers
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday declared victory against the "Russia Hoax" after a Florida court sided with him in a defamation lawsuit against the Pulitzer Prize Board relating to awards given for coverage of Russian interference US election.

title: "Agree With Shashi Tharoor...": Pawan Khera's Veiled Attack On Colleague
content: In a clear sign that Shashi Tharoor's ties with the Congress may be at a crossroads, senior party leader Pawan Khera has responded to the Thiruvananthapuram MP's "critics and trolls" post with a passage from his book

title: Sharpshooter Of Lawrence Bishnoi Gang Killed In Police Encounter In UP
content: Identified as Naveen Kumar, he was wanted in multiple cases, including for murder and under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA).

title: 'Laser focused' OKC races into 1st Finals since '12
content: The Thunder were "clicking on all cylinders" in Wednesday night's Game 5, reeling off their fourth win of 30 or more points to oust the Wolves and return to the NBA Finals.

title: Ant vows: 'Nobody's going to work harder than me'
content: Timberwolves guard Anthony Edwards made a promise to improve after Minnesota fell short of the NBA Finals for the second straight year.

title: Panthers to Cup Final: 'This year, it's all business'
content: The Panthers advanced to their third straight Stanley Cup Final with a 5-3 victory over the Hurricanes in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Williams makes it clear he wanted to be a Bear
content: Bears quarterback Caleb Williams on Wednesday defended his commitment to the organization that drafted him with the No. 1 pick in 2024.

title: Fever fall without Clark: 'A kind of gut punch'
content: The Fever's first game without star Caitlin Clark was rockier than they'd hoped, as they lost to the Mystics on Wednesday night in Baltimore.

title: Texas' Miller: No COVID year to hurt veteran depth
content: Texas coach Sean Miller said the lower number of players with an extra year of eligibility from the COVID-19 eligibility rules will hurt college basketball next season.

title: Messi, Suárez score 2 each in lopsided Miami win
content: Luis Suárez and Lionel Messi each finished with two goals and an assist to lead host Inter Miami to a 4-2 victory over CF Montreal on Wednesday night in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

title: Adelman wants Nuggets in even better condition
content: New Nuggets coach David Adelman, who was officially introduced Wednesday, wants his team to be in even better condition and open to new ideas come training camp.

title: The 2025 NFL season FPI projections are out: Eagles at No. 1, Saints at No. 32 in our debut ratings
content: ESPN's Football Power Index ratings are live. Let's predict the 2025 season, including playoff chances for 32 teams and potential draft order.

title: The five most astounding stats behind the 100-game stretch when the Tigers have ruled MLB
content: Detroit has been the best team in baseball since Aug. 11 of last season. Here's a breakdown of how it has done it.

title: 'The greatest to ever do it': How Patty Gasso built a superpower at Oklahoma
content: Former players, coaches on how Oklahoma softball coach Patty Gasso became the sport's greatest coach.

title: Storylines: Can Nelly Korda get back to winning? How will Erin Hills play?
content: The 80th U.S. Women's Open figures to be a tough test at Erin Hills Club. We break down some of the biggest things to watch ahead of the LPGA's second major of the year.

title: Chelsea didn't spend £1 billion to win the Conference League, but it's a start
content: The mere fact they were in the UECL is a reflection of the mistakes made to this point, but Chelsea's triumph on Wednesday can be the foundation for a far brighter future.

title: Chelsea eye more glory after sealing UEFA title set
content: Enzo Maresca believes Chelsea's Conference League success could be a "starting point" for further glory after ending the club's four-year wait for silverware.

title: Isco: Chelsea 'ran over us' in second-half collapse
content: Real Betis paid the price for taking their foot off the pedal after an impressive first half in Wednesday's Conference League final defeat by Chelsea, said their inspirational captain Isco and veteran coach Manuel Pellegrini.

title: Man Utd booed off after friendly loss in Malaysia
content: Manchester United were booed by fans at the final whistle after losing 1-0 in Malaysia against ASEAN All-Stars on Friday.

title: 'United' Miami adapt after Alba, Lujan injuries
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano commended his players for coming together and being "united" in a 4-2 win over Montreal at Chase Stadium on Wednesday night despite suffering three injuries in the first half.

title: James: Chelsea 'had to win' Conference League
content: Chelsea beat Real Betis in the Conference League final on Wednesday, sealing a preseason ambition to lift the trophy that Reece James believed they had to win.

title: Dress to impress: Inter to wear gold for UCL final
content: Inter Milan will dress for the occasion by wearing their third, golden yellow kit in Saturday's Champions League final when they face Paris Saint-Germain in Munich.

title: Henry: Arsenal have underachieved under Arteta
content: Arsenal legend Thierry Henry has said he believes the club should have won a trophy under Mikel Arteta.

title: Valkyries coach Natalie Nakase making history in the WNBA
content: Former Clippers assistant Natalie Nakase helped the Aces win two WNBA titles. Now she's in her first season as the head coach of the Valkyries.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: MAC preview: Ohio will need to fend off Toledo, Buffalo as it looks for repeat
content: Bill Connelly begins his conference previews with the MAC, which still has some high-level talent despite portal losses.

title: 2025 MLB mock draft 1.0: High school slugger or college ace at No. 1?
content: Starting with a wide-open top of the board, here's how the first round of this July's draft could play out.

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder big favorites to take title, Pacers move up
content: With the conference finals underway, here are the updated odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool join race for €100 million Ekitike
content: The race to acquire Hugo Ekitike has begun, with Liverpool and Chelsea set to fight for his signature.

title: The story of Arsenal's season: Did not signing a striker cost them the title?
content: A season that began with great optimism ended with Arsenal taking one step back in the Premier League but also a leap forward in the Champions League.

title: The unlimited potential of Brazilian prodigy Joao Fonseca
content: Joao Fonseca has drawn passionate crowds and defeated big names like Hubert Hurkacz. Is he the next tennis superstar?

title: Is this the last time we'll see line judges at a Grand Slam?
content: The French Open is the last of the majors to use human line judges -- and it's been a topic of debate in Paris.

title: Norris' win in Monaco has reset F1, McLaren title fight
content: Preseason title favorite Lando Norris was losing steam to teammate Oscar Piastri. That's no longer the case.

title: Grading how every SEC team performed in 2024-25
content: With a record 14 NCAA tournament bids, it's no surprise the SEC earned the most A's among power conferences.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

content: Tristan H. Cockcroft tries to figure out how to identify pitchers who might become the next big thing.

title: NBA draft player survey: Who's the most underrated prospect in this class?
content: college basketball insider Jeff Borzello joined draft analysts Jeremy Woo and Jonathan Givony at the draft combine in Chicago earlier this month . a small handful received multiple votes, some were named by college teammates, some made the case for themselves and others insisted players featured in ESPN's latest mock draft were still underrated .

title: 📷 Trends from OKC's last WCF title
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are on their way back to the NBA Finals . the 124-194 win made the Thunder just the third team to notch multiple series-clinching wins in a postseason . they last reached the finals in 2012 after they defeated Tim Duncan and the San Antonio Spurs in six games .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder dominate Wolves in Game 5
content: the Thunder beat the Timberwolves to reach the 2025 NBA conference finals . the new york Knicks and Indiana Pacers are potentially a game away from wrapping up their series . but the Thunder bounced back to win Game 4 in a back-and-forth battle before winning the series in dominant fashion .

title: NHL free agency big board: Where does Marner land? Who are the other top options?
content: the salary cap is projected to rise to $95.5 million next season; $104 million in 2026-27 . it could lead to more teams comfortably retaining their own players on expiring contracts . the unrestricted free agent field is organized into different tiers .

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: caitlin Clark's quad strain is the type of bad news all WNBA franchises must navigate . the loss of a starter is what keeps coaches and general managers awake at night . last season, the Minnesota Lynx went 3-2 without star forward Napheesa Collier .

title: Panthers move on to Cup Final: Grades, takeaways for both teams
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Carolina Hurricanes in five games to advance to their third consecutive Stanley Cup Final . the defending champions put an end to the discussion, with captain Aleksander Barkov using his strength to fend off Dmitry Orlov to set up Carter Verhaeghe for the series-clinching goal . this is now the 11th time in the past 12 years in which a Sun Belt team has played in the Stanley Cup final .

title: Previewing the WCWS: Strengths, (relative) weaknesses for every team
content: the 2025 NCAA softball tournament's overall no. 1 seed (Texas A&M) was knocked out before the super regionals . three unseeded teams took top-7 seeds to a third game . both teams lost Game 1 and were in serious trouble late in Game 2 .

title: Free agency and draft plans for Hurricanes, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . a breakdown of the biggest keys this offseason and realistic expectations for next season . each eliminated team will try to add via free agency, trades and the draft .

title: Congress vs Congress: Tharoor hits back at 'zealots', says 'I have better things to do'
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Pollachi Jayaraman seeks damages of ₹1 crore from eight YouTube channels
content: Also wants them to be restrained from linking him and his son, either directly or through inuendos, with the Pollachi serial sexual assault case

title: CEA Nageswaran cautions private sector about need to strike a balance between AI & labour
content: Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran said the country needs policies that are able “to focus on labour intensive manufacturing as well.”

title: Lower temperatures and increased humidity could spike malaria, dengue, chikungunya, and other diseases: Telangana DPH
content: The senior Health officials issued a health advisory urging citizens to take precautionary measures against seasonal illnesses

title: CM’s breakfast meeting with Congress MLC B. K. Hariprasad gives rise to speculation about Cabinet reshuffle in Karnataka
content: But, the Chief Minister told reporters that they discussed issues related to Mangaluru, which has been witnessing murders on communal lines

title: AgustaWestland case: Supreme Court rejects plea of Christian Michel
content: Christian Michel James, who is alleged to be a middleman in the case, had challenged the May 22 order of the High Court which modified his bail conditions.

title: Hindu religious leaders condemn Allahabad HC remark that Puranas written on hearsay
content: The Shankaracharya of Jyotirmath said that the remarks made by the judge in the disputed Krishna Janabhoomi structure case shows his ignorance on the religion.

title: Farmers need to explore agro products to increase income: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: “Farmers make a lot of effort in cultivating and harvesting crops, but beyond that, their role is negligible,” Jagdeep Dhankhar said

title: Monsoon fury: Red alert declared in 8 Kerala districts
content: Low-pressure system formed over northwest Bay of Bengal off Odisha coast intensifies into a depression

title: Schaeffler India opens new plant in Tamil Nadu
content: With this facility, Schaeffler India also aims to increase its transmission component capacity significantly

title: Making Anbumani a Cabinet Minister was my mistake: PMK founder Ramadoss
content: At a press conference at his Thailapuram residence in Villupuram district, Mr. Ramadoss launched a blistering attack on his son

title: Shivarajkumar responds to language row: Kamal Haasan holds Kannada in high regard
content: Kannada superstar Shivarajkumar has responded to the controversy around Kamal Haasan, emphasising mutual respect and admiration between the two actors

title: ‘Operation Chakra-V’: CBI arrests six members of cybercrime syndicate targeting Japanese citizens
content: The arrest follows a case registered by the CBI based on credible intelligence on a cybercrime syndicate cheating foreign nationals, particularly from Japan, by posing as technical support personnel from reputed multinational corporations, including Microsoft

title: Sharpshooter of Lawrence Bishnoi gang killed in police encounter in UP's Hapur
content: The deceased has been identified as Naveen Kumar, who was wanted in multiple cases, including for murder and under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act, police said

title: Karnataka forms Special Action Force to tackle communal incidents, hate speech in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Shivamogga
content: The Special Action Force, which will include 248 personnel from the Anti Naxal Force, will play a primary role in gathering intelligence on probable communcal and provocative incidents and hate speeches and and prevent them.

title: Arms license policy not for people near inter-State borders: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said the government will be lenient in providing arms licences to original inhabitants and indigenous communities in vulnerable and remote areas

title: People in PoK will return to India voluntarily: Rajnath Singh
content: The Defence Minister said most of the people in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir feel a "deep connection" with India and only a few of them have been "misled".

title: Rajesh: An actor who could traverse the arc of emotions
content: When Tamil cinema moved from the MGR-Sivaji Ganesan era and stepped into the decades shaped by Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan from the late 1970s and early 1980s, Rajesh carved his own unique space

title: Rajasthan government employee held for spying for Pakistan
content: Shakur Khan, who works in the district employment office, was found to have phone numbers associated with Pakistan stored on his device, the official said.

title: Operation Sindoor befitting reply to those who unleashed terror in India: PM Modi
content: Addressing the 50th anniversary of Sikkim's statehood function, Mr. Modi said the Himalayan state is the "pride of the nation" and its people believe in democracy.

title: CDS Gen. Chauhan to engage with global military leadership at Shangri-La Dialogue 2025  in Singapore
content: During the visit, General Anil Chauhan will hold bilateral meetings with Chiefs of Defence Forces and senior military leadership from several  countries including U.S., U.K., France, Germany and Australia

title: Heavy rain persists in Kerala as low-pressure system intensifies into depression
content: Low-pressure system moving northwards and is likely to make landfall between Sagar Island in West Bengal and Khepu Rock in Bangladesh by Thursday (May 29)  afternoon

title: No change in pattern, syllabus of WBCS examinations: Government
content: West Bengal Government cancels changes to WBCS examination pattern, maintaining old format instead of UPSC-style detailed answers

title: Congress vs. Tharoor battle erupts over MP’s comments on surgical strikes; he slams ‘zealots’
content: The Congress leader, leading a multi-party delegation to five countries, said that India breached the LoC between India and Pakistan to conduct a surgical strike on a terror base “for the first time” in 2016

title: Repeated attempts were made to merge BRS with BJP: MLC Kavitha
content: She sought to know why there was a social media war against her, including from social media handles operated from overseas

title: Signed copies of book in London in Kannada, says Booker prize winner Banu Mushtaq
content: During a felicitation by the Karnataka Union of Working Journalists, she shared her experience of travelling to London

title: Madurai Mayor’s husband Pon Vasanth suspended from DMK for ‘anti-party’ activities
content: DMK general secretary Duraimurugan announced his suspension on charges of violating party discipline and bringing disrepute to the organisation

title: Marine emergency response ship from Puducherry set to reach Kochi shipwreck site soon
content: Shipwreck experts on the search and recovery vessel to use latest equipment to scan the submerged Liberian ship and devise plan to drain very low sulfur fuel oil (VLSFO) stored in double hull to prevent further spillage

title: Veteran Tamil actor Rajesh passes away at 75
content: Rajesh collaborated with several top directors and actors during his career, including frequent work with K. Balachander and Kamal Haasan

title: Kerala Cabinet sanctions ₹982 crore for implementing Nava Kerala Sadas projects
content: Cabinet approves guidelines prepared by State Planning Board for implementing projects with amendments

title: Government of Karnataka gets ₹85.90 crore dividend cheque from KSIIDC
content: Large and Medium Industries Minister M.B. Patil handed over the dividend cheques to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah

title: Can FIR be quashed under Section 528 of BNSS? Allahabad High Court refers matter to nine-judge Bench
content: The single Bench of Justice Arun Kumar Singh Deshwal, while respectfully disagreeing with the seven-judge Bench ruling, referred the matter to a nine-judge Bench invoking the spirit of “judicial discipline” and the need to uphold the doctrine of stare decisis

title: Congress claims special Parliament session being considered to mark 50th anniversary of Emergency
content: “This will be yet another classic exercise in diversion and distraction from real and more urgent issues by the PM,” says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Pune Porsche case accused doctor now held in kidney transplant racket
content: The city crime branch has now taken him into custody in connection with the 2022 kidney transplant racket at Ruby Hall Clinic

title: BJP seeks withdrawal of user fee for garbage handling in Bengaluru
content: Leader of Opposition R. Ashok took exception to the government imposing user fee in addition to garbage cess

title: Belagavi women feature in film screened at Cannes film festival
content: The film by Indira Baikerikar is inspired by the real-life experience of her daughter Mallika, who is a national-level swimmer

title: Odisha increases upper age limit of government jobs from 32 to 42
content: It will also come up with Odisha Artificial Intelligence Policy-2025 for improving governance, stimulating innovation, enhancing data-driven decision-making and enabling inclusive socio-economic development

title: Isolated heavy rain likely as southwest monsoon reaches Vizag
content: Santhabommali of Srikakulam district records 152.4 mm of rain in 24 hours ending Wednesday morning, while Ichchapuram records 31.5 mm by 5 pm

title: Producer Dil Raju made me scapegoat, says suspended JSP leader
content: Jana Sena Party Rajamahendravaram City In-Charge Anusri Satyanarayana has been suspended from the party as well as City In-Charge for his alleged role in giving a call for  theatres bandh from June 1 ahead of the release of Pawan Kalyan’s ‘Hari Hara Veera Mallu’.

title: Do Roti and a world of difference: activist’s simple recipe to tackle hunger, ignite humanity
content: For the last decade, Azhar Maqsusi, a Hyderabad-based activist working to feed the poor, has been running the ‘Do Roti’ campaign in an effort to empathise with and assist those who cannot afford a meal

title: PUCL questions ‘inaction’ against hate speech and communalism
content: ‘Silence and police inaction’ had emboldened individuals to take yet another life, says the organisation

title: Veteran Akali leader Sukhdev Singh Dhindsa dies at 89; political leaders express grief
content: Political leaders across parties condoled the death of Dhindsa, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi calling him a “towering statesman with great wisdom and an unwavering commitment to public service”

title: The importance of the Deputy Speaker
content: The Deputy Speaker is not a mere substitute of the Speaker; he plays an indispensable role in maintaining the continuity of legislative work. Conventionally, this position has been handed over to the Opposition, in order to develop harmony between the ruling party and the Opposition

title: All-party delegations receive support from world leaders in India’s fight against terror
content: India has tasked seven multi-party delegations to visit 33 global capitals to reach out to the international community on Pakistan’s designs and India’s response to terror

title: Karnataka clears investments worth ₹17,182 crore with potential to create 12,496 direct jobs
content: State High-Level Clearance Committee headed by the Chief Minister and the State-Level Single-Window Clearance Committee headed by the Large and Medium Industries Minister clear projects

title: Huma Qureshi attends tourism event in Jammu, praises forces for Operation Sindoor
content: Amid chants of ‘Bharat Mata Ki Jai’, Ms. Qureshi interacted with the border guards, including its women personnel, who were on the forefront during Operation Sindoor to counter cross-border shelling and drone attacks by Pakistan

title: Foreign students face uncertainty as Trump steps up attack on universities
content: In April, the federal government froze more than $2 billion in grants and contracts with Harvard, citing non-compliance with requests to modify hiring and admissions policies, dismantle diversity-equity-inclusion programmes, and conduct ideological vetting of international students

title: MLAs from Madiga community meet Meenakshi Natarajan, make fresh demand for Cabinet berths
content: In a memorandum submitted to Meenakshi Natarajan, they underscored the community’s strong support for the Congress, both historically and in the recent Telangana Assembly election

title: Delhi, followed by Maharashtra, sent back the most number of ‘illegal’ Bangladeshi immigrants
content: In the past six months, a number of allegedly ‘illegal’ immigrants from Bangladesh have been detained in the BJP-ruled States of Delhi, Maharashtra, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, and Goa

title: Parents of slain R.G. Kar doctor back junior colleagues facing ‘punishment postings’

title: Stalin to inaugurate free houses for Irular families near Arakkonam today

content: The court says actions of DDA officials cumulatively resulted in “flagrant contempt” of apex court directions on tree felling

content: A full bench headed by Chairperson Justice A.M. Khanwilkar concluded that “the allegations in the complaints are more on presumptions and assumptions and not supported by any verifiable material”

title: Maharashtra government approves Dharavi project master plan
content: Top priority of the project should be rehabilitation of local artisans and small unit owners, says Fadnavis

title: U.S. Embassy, consulates in India put new student visa appointments on pause
content: It is unclear how long the pause on student visa appointments will continue, raising questions over admissions for Indian and other international students for the new term beginning in September 2025

title: Trump used offers of trade access to broker India-Pakistan ceasefire, claims U.S. Commerce Secretary
content: U.S. officials tell court that tariffs are key to U.S. national security, citing India-Pakistan ceasefire; MEA insisted ceasefire did not involve U.S. mediation, said trade was not part of talks with U.S. on Operation Sindoor

title: NHAI to construct viaduct to replace collapsed NH-66
content: NHAI regional officer says bridge appeared the only remedial measure to address the failure of the 276-metre stretch of the elevated highway at Kooriyad

title: Vigil continues as heavy rain hits normal life in Kozhikode

title: U.P. CM Yogi reviews preparations in Kanpur ahead of PM Modi’s visit on May 30
content: Modi will visit the city to inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for a slew of development projects

title: Free movement will take time, government tells Meiteis

title: CPI MP writes a letter to all political parties calling for an impeachment against Allahabad HC judge Yashwant Varma
